definition: to be in charge of something specific
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

sentences.english: Creat a "photo wall"for displaying your best memories.
sentences.chinese: 建立一面“照片墙”，专管你们值得纪念的照片。

sentences.english: Customers who do sub-specialized personnel to follow up.
sentences.chinese: 做到客户分人跟进专人专管。

sentences.english: I mean that of the very working the die, as they call it.
sentences.chinese: 我指的是他们所谓的专管印模。

sentences.english: From then on I spent the whole day standing at the bar manning my post.
sentences.chinese: 我从此便整天的站在柜台里，专管我的职务。

sentences.english: Thenceforward I stood all day behind the counter, fully engaged with my duties.
sentences.chinese: 我从此便整天的站在柜台里，专管我的职务。

sentences.english: After that I stood all day behind the bar attending to my duties.
sentences.chinese: 我从此便整天站在柜台里，专管我的职务。

in charge (of a position etc)/the person in charge/responsible
internal affairs/domestic affairs/family affairs/(trad.) affairs within the palace
to supervise (troops)/to appoint (officers)/to select and assign
